title: Chronic Salary Delays
scenario: The CEO (card reader) delays salary payments for the third consecutive month with vague excuses (cash flow problems, waiting for new investment).

individualCost.description: The CEO ruins the relationship from the ground up

teamResults.description: Leads to transparency and financial improvement

title: Endless General Meetings
scenario: The company's general meetings have become very long, with no clear agenda, and are exhausting. The card reader (Manager/Meeting Leader) continues without regard for the time.

teamResults.description: Negotiating to reduce time and increase focus in meetings

title: Covering for Underperformance & Empty Promises
scenario: Colleagues are slacking on the project, and the CEO (card reader) constantly asks you to cover their work, promising a "big promotion" or "raise" in the future.

individualCost.description: The CEO might remove you from important projects

title: Mentoring an Unpaid Intern
scenario: A new intern has arrived. The CEO asks you, despite your high workload, to mentor them, without any mention of compensation or extra pay.

individualCost.description: Because you have to spend part of your work time negotiating

teamResults.description: Setting boundaries leads to fairer resource allocation

title: Old Documentation Crisis
scenario: You realize that key product documents (like APIs or Onboarding processes) are very old or incomplete. This problem frequently stops your work and forces you to ask colleagues questions. The card reader (Team Lead) says documentation "isn't a priority."

individualGain.description: Defending engineering work and personal time

individualCost.description: Because you have to put in extra time to do the Gap Analysis yourself

teamResults.description: Solving the problem at its root in the long term
